body:
This report is for 1.41 but the code looks unchanged in master.  Can you get it to do this often or was it just a one-off?

The log + traceback looks like this

```
2018/07/04 21:08:45 ERROR : hZHyminAJ2S4WIDoc5Qlrg==/nnzGs0CkaF0QP1b-Z1DfWw==/Yg45xm4Jj-zl3YWMUI6qgw==/7cH5GbC_BcCmtNc2RBlZvaVL0dCDQIOzhjKZy7UGqXA=/4bg5QamlFkK16-kMFum4VJtfiUKazgl9AlM4M0tUYLkSS9Jao_r4i4Cb9zC3iAA0: unexpected conditions during reading. current position: 3388866560, current chunk position: 3386900480, current chunk size: 1449984, offset: 1966080, chunk size: 10485760, file size: 6881591176
2018/07/04 21:08:45 ERROR : hZHyminAJ2S4WIDoc5Qlrg==/nnzGs0CkaF0QP1b-Z1DfWw==/Yg45xm4Jj-zl3YWMUI6qgw==/7cH5GbC_BcCmtNc2RBlZvaVL0dCDQIOzhjKZy7UGqXA=/4bg5QamlFkK16-kMFum4VJtfiUKazgl9AlM4M0tUYLkSS9Jao_r4i4Cb9zC3iAA0: ReadFileHandle.Read error: low level retry 1/10: unexpected EOF

fatal error: concurrent map writes

goroutine 140156 [running]:
runtime.throw(0x103333c, 0x15)
	/opt/go/go1.10/src/runtime/panic.go:619 +0x81 fp=0xc4223e17e0 sp=0xc4223e17c0 pc=0x42b131
runtime.mapassign_fast64(0xea5d60, 0xc424a4f3e0, 0x1, 0x20)
	/opt/go/go1.10/src/runtime/hashmap_fast.go:531 +0x2f6 fp=0xc4223e1828 sp=0xc4223e17e0 pc=0x40b7e6
github.com/ncw/rclone/backend/cache.(*Object).Hash(0xc4206b2140, 0x1, 0xc4223e1970, 0xc4208ae418, 0xc4208ae420, 0x410e88)
	/home/ncw/go/src/github.com/ncw/rclone/backend/cache/object.go:318 +0x13a fp=0xc4223e18a8 sp=0xc4223e1828 pc=0x8da76a
github.com/ncw/rclone/vfs.(*ReadFileHandle).checkHash(0xc420302380, 0x0, 0x0)
	/home/ncw/go/src/github.com/ncw/rclone/vfs/read.go:274 +0x150 fp=0xc4223e19e0 sp=0xc4223e18a8 pc=0xcead70
github.com/ncw/rclone/vfs.(*ReadFileHandle).close(0xc420302380, 0xc420692780, 0x103f890)
	/home/ncw/go/src/github.com/ncw/rclone/vfs/read.go:338 +0xa6 fp=0xc4223e1a10 sp=0xc4223e19e0 pc=0xceb176
github.com/ncw/rclone/vfs.(*ReadFileHandle).Release(0xc420302380, 0x0, 0x0)
	/home/ncw/go/src/github.com/ncw/rclone/vfs/read.go:388 +0xea fp=0xc4223e1a80 sp=0xc4223e1a10 pc=0xceb51a
github.com/ncw/rclone/cmd/mount.(*FileHandle).Release(0xc4201a2520, 0x11381e0, 0xc4222f37c0, 0xc4221b6be0, 0xc4201a2520, 0x1001)
	/home/ncw/go/src/github.com/ncw/rclone/cmd/mount/handle.go:83 +0x11b fp=0xc4223e1ae0 sp=0xc4223e1a80 pc=0xcfde8b
github.com/ncw/rclone/vendor/bazil.org/fuse/fs.(*Server).handleRequest(0xc42071c0c0, 0x11381e0, 0xc4222f37c0, 0x112c840, 0xc42000c088, 0xc421388940, 0x1136720, 0xc4221b6be0, 0xc4223e1ef8, 0xc4220b9f80, ...)
	/home/ncw/go/src/github.com/ncw/rclone/vendor/bazil.org/fuse/fs/serve.go:1301 +0x2a08 fp=0xc4223e1e10 sp=0xc4223e1ae0 pc=0xcd9568
github.com/ncw/rclone/vendor/bazil.org/fuse/fs.(*Server).serve(0xc42071c0c0, 0x1136720, 0xc4221b6be0)
	/home/ncw/go/src/github.com/ncw/rclone/vendor/bazil.org/fuse/fs/serve.go:878 +0x41e fp=0xc4223e1fa0 sp=0xc4223e1e10 pc=0xcd673e
github.com/ncw/rclone/vendor/bazil.org/fuse/fs.(*Server).Serve.func1(0xc42071c0c0, 0x1136720, 0xc4221b6be0)
	/home/ncw/go/src/github.com/ncw/rclone/vendor/bazil.org/fuse/fs/serve.go:425 +0x6e fp=0xc4223e1fc8 sp=0xc4223e1fa0 pc=0xcdb01e
runtime.goexit()
	/opt/go/go1.10/src/runtime/asm_amd64.s:2361 +0x1 fp=0xc4223e1fd0 sp=0xc4223e1fc8 pc=0x458c41
created by github.com/ncw/rclone/vendor/bazil.org/fuse/fs.(*Server).Serve
	/home/ncw/go/src/github.com/ncw/rclone/vendor/bazil.org/fuse/fs/serve.go:423 +0x331
```

Which points at this code.  What I suspect is Hash() is being called concurrently and both calls are making a new Hash at the same time.

```go
// Hash requests a hash of the object and stores in the cache
// since it might or might not be called, this is lazy loaded
func (o *Object) Hash(ht hash.Type) (string, error) {
	_ = o.refresh()
	if o.CacheHashes == nil {
		o.CacheHashes = make(map[hash.Type]string)
	}

	cachedHash, found := o.CacheHashes[ht]
	if found {
		return cachedHash, nil
	}
	if err := o.refreshFromSource(false); err != nil {
		return "", err
	}
	liveHash, err := o.Object.Hash(ht)
	if err != nil {
		return "", err
	}
	o.CacheHashes[ht] = liveHash // <- PROBLEM

	o.persist()
	fs.Debugf(o, "object hash cached: %v", liveHash)

	return liveHash, nil
}
```

@remusb thoughts?

I've had this happen twice in an eight-hour period. (I've been using rclone cache mount for about thirty-six  hours as of this morning). I've tried various settings but it did not start happening until I added --fuse-flag sync_read to the rclone command, and -ko sync to the gocryptfs command.

My suspicion is the -ko sync option being passed is mucking things up. Gocryptfs has a -serialize_reads option which may be a better suited but I am waiting on an admin to update my gocryptfs installation before I can try that with --fuse-flag sync_read.

After this error I dismounted everything and am now running rclone mount with --fuse-flag sync_read and gocryptfs without -ko sync, and the eight hours it ran overnight, it has not crashed yet.

The reason I've added those options is that it seems to greatly improve accessing the cache when it is a network storage on the other end. Though from what I've read top-end throughput speeds could be brought down.

I like what you mentioned about the hash firing concurrently. Another thing to consider is that gocryptfs is file-level encryption, and it has to read each .dirIV file, and the folder/contents; it's a lot going on.

The problem has a fairly obvious cause and fix so I don't think it will be difficult to fix since we have a traceback.

I'd like to hear what @remusb has to say about the problem though.

Hi, I started an rclone session on windows with a cache backed sftp remote, and almost immediately got this error

```
>rclone -v mount --read-only remote:/home/git j:
2019/06/04 19:26:19 INFO  : remote: Cache DB path: C:\Users\redacted\AppData\Local\rclone\cache-backend\remote.db
2019/06/04 19:26:19 INFO  : remote: Cache chunk path: C:\Users\redacted\AppData\Local\rclone\cache-backend\remote
2019/06/04 19:26:19 INFO  : remote: Chunk Memory: true

2019/06/04 19:26:19 INFO  : remote: File Age: 6h0m0s
2019/06/04 19:26:19 INFO  : Cache remote remote:home/git: poll-interval is not supported by this remote
The service rclone has been started.
fatal error: concurrent map writes

goroutine 232 [running, locked to thread]:

        C:/go/src/runtime/panic.go:608 +0x79 fp=0xc000a21b70 sp=0xc000a21b40 pc=0x430799
runtime.mapassign_fast64(0x1140a40, 0xc000111ce0, 0x1, 0x20)
        C:/go/src/runtime/map_fast64.go:101 +0x30c fp=0xc000a21bb0 sp=0xc000a21b70 pc=0x41320c
github.com/ncw/rclone/backend/cache.(*Object).Hash(0xc0007c1c20, 0x1, 0xc000a21ce8, 0x0, 0xc000060040, 0x5460)
        C:/gopath/src/github.com/ncw/rclone/backend/cache/object.go:326 +0x12a fp=0xc000a21c28 sp=0xc000a21bb0 pc=0x98c9ea
github.com/ncw/rclone/vfs.(*ReadFileHandle).checkHash(0xc0004b42a0, 0x13a25f0, 0xc0004b42a0)
        C:/gopath/src/github.com/ncw/rclone/vfs/read.go:292 +0x153 fp=0xc000a21d58 sp=0xc000a21c28 pc=0xeac183
github.com/ncw/rclone/vfs.(*ReadFileHandle).Flush(0xc0004b42a0, 0x0, 0x0)
        C:/gopath/src/github.com/ncw/rclone/vfs/read.go:382 +0x85 fp=0xc000a21dc0 sp=0xc000a21d58 pc=0xeac745
github.com/ncw/rclone/cmd/cmount.(*FS).Flush(0xc000136d00, 0xc00095cce0, 0x10, 0x81, 0xc0006203c0)
        C:/gopath/src/github.com/ncw/rclone/cmd/cmount/fs.go:380 +0x1f1 fp=0xc000a21e40 sp=0xc000a21dc0 pc=0xec1801
github.com/ncw/rclone/vendor/github.com/billziss-gh/cgofuse/fuse.hostFlush(0x2240f10, 0x690fe40, 0x0)
        C:/gopath/src/github.com/ncw/rclone/vendor/github.com/billziss-gh/cgofuse/fuse/host.go:829 +0xb2 fp=0xc000a21e88 sp=0xc000a21e40 pc=0xe99212
github.com/ncw/rclone/vendor/github.com/billziss-gh/cgofuse/fuse._cgoexpwrap_b0480560eb0d_hostFlush(0x2240f10, 0x690fe40, 0x80)
        _cgo_gotypes.go:749 +0x3c fp=0xc000a21eb0 sp=0xc000a21e88 pc=0xe966dc
runtime.call32(0x0, 0x690fc70, 0x690fde0, 0x18)
        C:/go/src/runtime/asm_amd64.s:522 +0x42 fp=0xc000a21ee0 sp=0xc000a21eb0 pc=0x45cb42
runtime.cgocallbackg1(0x0)
        C:/go/src/runtime/cgocall.go:316 +0x1a9 fp=0xc000a21f58 sp=0xc000a21ee0 pc=0x404739
runtime.cgocallbackg(0x0)
        C:/go/src/runtime/cgocall.go:194 +0xeb fp=0xc000a21fc0 sp=0xc000a21f58 pc=0x4044eb
runtime.cgocallback_gofunc(0x0, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0)
        C:/go/src/runtime/asm_amd64.s:775 +0xb2 fp=0xc000a21fe0 sp=0xc000a21fc0 pc=0x45e1a2
runtime.goexit()
        C:/go/src/runtime/asm_amd64.s:1333 +0x1 fp=0xc000a21fe8 sp=0xc000a21fe0 pc=0x45e931

```

This is my entire config file.  The remote host is over a slowish internet connection which is why caching seemed a good idea.

```
[_remote]
type = sftp
host = remote
user = root
key_use_agent = true

[remote]
type = cache
remote = _remote:

```

Am i doing something obviously wrong?

Thanks

> Am i doing something obviously wrong?

No it is a bug.

Can you try this fix?

https://beta.rclone.org/branch/v1.47.0-097-gf46c5bc1-fix-2378-cache-crash-beta/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

Is this bug still relevant?

Did you have a go with the beta posted above?

Thanks
